ItemModel.Name: Abacus
ItemModel.Description: A standard tool used to make calculations.

ItemModel.Name: Abjuration Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Acid (vial)
ItemModel.Description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

ItemModel.Name: Acid Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Agate
ItemModel.Description: A light brown gemstone

ItemModel.Name: Alchemist's Fire (flask)
ItemModel.Description: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

ItemModel.Name: Alchemist's Supplies
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Ale (bottle)
ItemModel.Description: A bottle of common ale

ItemModel.Name: Ale (gallon)
ItemModel.Description: A gallon of ale

ItemModel.Name: Ale (mug)
ItemModel.Description: A mug of ale (pint)

ItemModel.Name: Alexandrite
ItemModel.Description: A transparent dark green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Algea
ItemModel.Description: Ocean / Coast ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Alms Box
ItemModel.Description: A small box for alms, typically found in a priest's pack.

ItemModel.Name: Amber
ItemModel.Description: A transparent watery gold to rich gold gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Amethyst
ItemModel.Description: A transparent deep purple gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Amulet
ItemModel.Description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

ItemModel.Name: Amulet of Health
ItemModel.Description: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher without it.

ItemModel.Name: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location
ItemModel.Description: While wearing this amulet, you are hidden from divination magic. You can't be targeted by such magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

ItemModel.Name: Amulet of the Planes
ItemModel.Description: While wearing this amulet, you can use an action to name a location that you are familiar with on another plane of existence. Then make a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a successful check, you cast the plane shift spell. On a failure, you and each creature and object within 15 feet of you travel to a random destination. Roll a d100. On a 1–60, you travel to a random location on the plane you named. On a 61–100, you travel to a randomly determined plane of existence.

ItemModel.Name: Animated Shield
ItemModel.Description:
While holding this shield, you can speak its command word as a bonus action to cause it to animate. The shield leaps into the air and hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, until you use a bonus action to end this effect, or until you are incapacitated or die, at which point the shield falls to the ground or into your hand if you have one free.
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

ItemModel.Name: Anklet of Haste
ItemModel.Description: When worn it grants the wearer +5 movement speed.
ItemModel.Lore: “Quickly now, lest these bandits catch us unaware we should at least be able to make our escape.” - Elder Ungrila

ItemModel.Name: Antitoxin
ItemModel.Description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

ItemModel.Name: Apollo's Lute
ItemModel.Description:
The strings of this lute glow from the magic contained within. When wielded by a skilled musician, it can provide great boons to their allies.
1 song per long rest 3 encores per long rest
When playing a song, the wielder must spend 5 minutes playing the song based on the effect that they want to provide. When played, up to 6 chosen creatures can gain the benefit provided by the song and Performance check made. A benefited creature can use these dice rolls at any time within 1 hour of hearing the song, after which any remaining charges are expended.
After a song is played, the wielder can use an action to spend an Encore charge, which will give up to 6 chosen creatures an additional 1d6 of the same effect as the song.
Damage dealing benefits can be used on a weapon attack hit or ranged / melee spell attack hit. Other boons behave as described per song.
Song Performance Check : Dice Gained 1 - 8 : 1d6 9 - 16 : 2d6 17 - 24 : 3d6 25+ : 4d6
Encore : 1d6
If multiple dice are gained from the performance, creatures can choose how many to expend during each use (with the exception of Kickstart my Heart which uses them all immediately)
Song : Benefit Toxic : acid damage on hit Inside the Fire : fire damage on hit Thunderstruck : thunder damage on hit Cold as Ice : cold damage on hit Kickstart my Heart : creatures immediately roll their dice to gain that many temporary hit points Touch of Red : creatures can add the dice to an attack roll Shield Wall : creatures can add the dice to their AC as a reaction (like the shield spell) Crawling Through Knives : creatures that take damage from a melee attacker can use their reaction to deal piercing damage back to the attacker

ItemModel.Name: Aquamarine
ItemModel.Description: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Aquaroot
ItemModel.Description: Ocean / Coast ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Arcane Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Armor of Invulnerability
ItemModel.Description:
You have resistance to nonmagical damage while you wear this armor. Additionally, you can use an action to make yourself immune to nonmagical damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this special action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.
Notes: Resistance: Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Weapons, Immunity: Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Weapons, Combat, Warding, Str 15 Required, Stealth Disadvantage

ItemModel.Name: Arrow
ItemModel.Description: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

ItemModel.Name: Ashen Cloak
ItemModel.Description: Twice per long rest, the creature attuned to and wearing this cloak can use their reaction to reduce incoming fire damage to half.

ItemModel.Name: Assassin's Blood
ItemModel.Description: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 6 (1d12) poison damage and is poisoned for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't poisoned.

ItemModel.Name: Autumn's Grace
ItemModel.Description: Magic ring. Has a single charge per day. As an action, the wielder can cast Feather Fall on themselves for 1 minute.

ItemModel.Name: Azurite
ItemModel.Description: An opaque mottled deep blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Backpack
ItemModel.Description: A backpack is a leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it. A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

ItemModel.Name: Bag of Holding
ItemModel.Description:
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.
If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.
Placing a bag of holding inside an extradimensional space created by a handy haversack, portable hole, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

ItemModel.Name: Bagpipes
ItemModel.Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use bagpipes as a spellcasting focus.

ItemModel.Name: Ball Bearings
ItemModel.Description: As an action, you can spill these 1000 tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

ItemModel.Name: Banded Agate
ItemModel.Description: A translucent striped brown, blue, white, or red gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Barrel
ItemModel.Description: A barrel can hold 40 gallons of liquid, or 4 cubic feet of solid material.

ItemModel.Name: Basic Poison (vial)
ItemModel.Description: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

ItemModel.Name: Basket
ItemModel.Description: A basket can hold 2 cubic feet/40 pounds of gear.

ItemModel.Name: Battleaxe
ItemModel.Description: 1d8 slashing, 1d10 versatile

ItemModel.Name: Bedroll
ItemModel.Description: You never know where you’re going to sleep, and a bedroll helps you get better sleep in a hayloft or on the cold ground. A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied. In an emergency, it can double as a stretcher.

ItemModel.Name: Bell
ItemModel.Description: A standard bell that rings, typically used for signaling.

ItemModel.Name: Bindweed
ItemModel.Description: Desert / Badlands ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Birdpipes
ItemModel.Description: Pan pipes or satyr pipes, also known as the shalm, these are sacred to Lliira and popular with wood elf and wild elf bards.

ItemModel.Name: Bit and Bridle
ItemModel.Description: Standard equipment used to direct a mount.

ItemModel.Name: Bittercress
ItemModel.Description: Mountain / Cave ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Black Opal
ItemModel.Description: A translucent dark green with black mottling and golden flecks gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Black Pearl
ItemModel.Description: An opaque pure black gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Black Sap
ItemModel.Description: This tarry substance harvested from the dark boughs of the death’s head willow is a powerful intoxicant. It can be smoked as a concentrate or injected directly into the bloodstream. A creature subjected to a dose of black sap cannot be charmed or frightened for 1d6 hours. For each dose of black sap consumed, a creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 2d4 hours—an effect that is cumulative with multiple doses.

ItemModel.Name: Black Sapphire
ItemModel.Description: A translucent lustrous black gemstone with glowing highlights worth 5,000 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Blackhaw
ItemModel.Description: Desert / Badlands ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Blanket
ItemModel.Description: A thick, quilted, blanket made to keep you warm in cold weather.

ItemModel.Name: Blessed Chalice of Feronia
ItemModel.Description: When a creature that is not Undead or a Fiend drinks holy water from the chalice, they are granted the power of a Bless spell.
ItemModel.Lore: “As we pay homage to our lady of divine health, we give thanks for the cup of life which gives us strength from within.” - Pastor Yolnik

ItemModel.Name: Blight Ichor
ItemModel.Description: This bitter chartreuse concoction is distilled from a fungus native to the Blightshore badlands. The sickly green liqueur harbors potent psychedelic properties. Provided it is neither a construct nor undead, a creature subjected to a dose of blight ichor gains advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom checks, as well as vulnerability to psychic damage, for 1 hour. For each dose of blight ichor consumed, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1d6 hours and suffer the effects of a confusion spell for 1 minute. An undead creature subjected to a dose of blight ichor gains advantage on all Dexterity checks and is immune to the frightened condition for 1 hour.

ItemModel.Name: Block and Tackle
ItemModel.Description: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects, a block and tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

ItemModel.Name: Block of Incense
ItemModel.Description: A block of incense, typically found in a priest's pack.

ItemModel.Name: Blood of the Lycanthrope
ItemModel.Description: This poison is created from blood harvested from a dead or incapacitated lycanthrope in its animal or hybrid form. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with lycanthropy (see the Monster Manual). The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

ItemModel.Name: Bloodroot
ItemModel.Description: Desert / Badlands ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Bloodstone
ItemModel.Description: An opaque dark gray gemstone with red flecks worth 50 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Blowgun
ItemModel.Description: 1 piercing, 25/100

ItemModel.Name: Blowgun Needle
ItemModel.Description: Blowgun needles are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

ItemModel.Name: Blue Quartz
ItemModel.Description: A transparent pale blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Blue Sapphire
ItemModel.Description: A transparent blue-white to medium blue gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Blue Spinel
ItemModel.Description: A transparent deep blue gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Bomb
ItemModel.Description: As an action, a character can light this bomb and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 fire damage.

ItemModel.Name: Book
ItemModel.Description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

ItemModel.Name: Boomerang
ItemModel.Description: 1d4 bludgeoning, 60/120

ItemModel.Name: Boots
ItemModel.Description: A pair of boots - included as part of most sets of clothing.

ItemModel.Name: Boxelder
ItemModel.Description: Forest / Woodland ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Bread
ItemModel.Description: A loaf of bread

ItemModel.Name: Breastplate
ItemModel.Description: Medium, AC 14 + Dex (max 2). This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

ItemModel.Name: Brewer's Supplies
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Brilliant Shield
ItemModel.Description: Metal shield with a brilliantly polished finish that emits a soft but visible glow. This shield provides an additional +1 AC compared to a normal shield (for a total of +3). Once per long rest, as an action, the wielder can use the shield to cast intense light in a 15 foot cone. Each creature who is not Blinded within the cone must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes blinded until the end of their next turn.

ItemModel.Name: Bronze Necklace
ItemModel.Description: A necklace with a small bronze pendant.

ItemModel.Name: Bucket
ItemModel.Description: A bucket can hold 3 gallons of liquid, or 1/2 cubic foot of solid material.

ItemModel.Name: Buckthorn
ItemModel.Description: Grassland / Hillside ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Bullseye Lantern
ItemModel.Description: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

ItemModel.Name: Burglar's Pack
ItemModel.Description: Includes a backpack, a bag of 1,000 ball bearings, 10 feet of string, a bell, 5 candles, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, a hooded lantern, 2 flasks of oil, 5 days rations, a tinderbox, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

ItemModel.Name: Burnt Othur Fumes
ItemModel.Description: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) poison damage, and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the character takes 3 (1d6) poison damage. After three successful saves, the poison ends.

ItemModel.Name: Calligrapher's Supplies
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Caltrops
ItemModel.Description: As an action, you can spread a bag of 20 caltrops to cover a square area that is 5 feet on a side. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. Taking this damage reduces the creature's walking speed by 10 feet until the creature regains at least 1 hit point. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

ItemModel.Name: Candle
ItemModel.Description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet

ItemModel.Name: Cannabis
ItemModel.Description: Grassland / Hillside ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Carnelian
ItemModel.Description: An opaque orange to red-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Carpenter's Tools
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Cartographer's Tools
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Censer
ItemModel.Description: A censer, typically found in a priest's pack.

ItemModel.Name: Chain (10 ft)
ItemModel.Description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

ItemModel.Name: Chain Mail
ItemModel.Description: AC 16, Str 13, Stealth Disadvantage. Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

ItemModel.Name: Chain Shirt
ItemModel.Description: AC 13 + Dex (max 2). Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

ItemModel.Name: Chalcedony
ItemModel.Description: An opaque white gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Chalk
ItemModel.Description: A piece of chalk used for writing and marking on various surfaces.

ItemModel.Name: Charlock
ItemModel.Description: Desert / Badlands ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Cheese
ItemModel.Description: A 1 lb. hunk of cheese

ItemModel.Name: Chest
ItemModel.Description: A chest can hold 12 cubic feet/ 300 pounds of gear.

ItemModel.Name: Chrysanthemum
ItemModel.Description: Grassland / Hillside ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Chrysoberyl
ItemModel.Description: A transparent yellow-green to pale green gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Chrysoprase
ItemModel.Description: A translucent green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Citrine
ItemModel.Description: A transparent pale yellow-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Climber's Kit
ItemModel.Description: A climber's kit includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use the climber's kit as an action to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself, and you can't climb more than 25 feet away from that point without undoing the anchor.

ItemModel.Name: Cloak of Protection
ItemModel.Description: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak. (requires attunement)

ItemModel.Name: Cloth Roll
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb roll of cloth

ItemModel.Name: Club
ItemModel.Description: 1d4 bludgeoning

ItemModel.Name: Cobbler's Tools
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Cold Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Common Clothes
ItemModel.Description: This set of clothes could consist of a loose shirt and baggy breeches, or a loose shirt and skirt or overdress. Cloth wrappings are used for shoes.

ItemModel.Name: Common Wine
ItemModel.Description: A pitcher of common wine

ItemModel.Name: Component Pouch
ItemModel.Description: A component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

ItemModel.Name: Conjuration Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Cook's Utensils
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Coral
ItemModel.Description: Ocean / Coast ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Coral Gem
ItemModel.Description: An opaque crimson gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Costume Clothes
ItemModel.Description: This set of clothes is fashioned after a particular costume, typically meant for entertaining.

ItemModel.Name: Crawler Mucus
ItemModel.Description: This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated crawler. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

ItemModel.Name: Crossbow Bolt
ItemModel.Description: Crossbow bolts are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

ItemModel.Name: Crossbow Bolt Case
ItemModel.Description: This wooden case can hold up to twenty crossbow bolts.

ItemModel.Name: Crowbar
ItemModel.Description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

ItemModel.Name: Crude Battleaxe
ItemModel.Description: 1d8 slashing, 1d10 versatile

ItemModel.Name: Crude Leather Armor
ItemModel.Description: AC 10 +Dex

ItemModel.Name: Crude Plate Armor
ItemModel.Description: AC 15, STR 15, Stealth Disadvantage. This dented and rusted set of plate armor is typically found worn by monsters in the wild who have pieced it together from fallen adventurers.

ItemModel.Name: Crude Scimitar
ItemModel.Description: 1d6 slashing

ItemModel.Name: Crushed Black Pearl
ItemModel.Description: A fine powder made from a black pearl.

ItemModel.Name: Crystal
ItemModel.Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: Dagger
ItemModel.Description: 1d4 piercing, 20/60

ItemModel.Name: Dagger of Venom
ItemModel.Description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
You can use an action to cause thick, black poison to coat the blade. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next dawn.
Proficiency with a dagger allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

ItemModel.Name: Daisy
ItemModel.Description: Grassland / Hillside ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Dark Common Clothes
ItemModel.Description: A dark set of common clothes that includes a hood.

ItemModel.Name: Dart
ItemModel.Description: 1d4 piercing, 20/60

ItemModel.Name: Deck of Marked Cards
ItemModel.Description: Deck of cards that have been subtly marked so that the owner can tell what the card is from the back.

ItemModel.Name: Dewberry
ItemModel.Description: Mountain / Cave ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Diamond
ItemModel.Description: A transparent blue-white, canary, pink, brown, or blue gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Diamond (Raise Dead)
ItemModel.Description: Diamond typically used for the Raise Dead spell

ItemModel.Name: Diamond Dust
ItemModel.Description: Diamond dust used for spellcasting.

ItemModel.Name: Dice Set
ItemModel.Description: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

ItemModel.Name: Diplomat's Pack
ItemModel.Description: Includes a chest, 2 cases for maps and scrolls, a set of fine clothes, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, a lamp, 2 flasks of oil, 5 sheets of paper, a vial of perfume, sealing wax, and soap.

ItemModel.Name: Disguise Kit
ItemModel.Description: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a visual disguise.

ItemModel.Name: Divination Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Double-Bladed Scimitar
ItemModel.Description:
2d4 slashing. The double-bladed scimitar is the signature weapon of Valenar elves. A haft of fine wood supports a long, curving blade on either end. Forged with techniques honed over centuries, these blades are strong, sharp, and remarkably light. Each scimitar is a masterpiece, and as a result the double-bladed scimitar is an expensive weapon (100 gp) — few though ever have the opportunity to purchase one. A Valenar blade in the hands of a non-elf is generally assumed to have been stolen or looted from a fallen foe, and a Valenar elf might feel entitled to demand its return or challenge the bearer to prove they’re worthy to wield it.
Special. If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4.

ItemModel.Name: Dragonchess Set
ItemModel.Description: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

ItemModel.Name: Dragon's Blood
ItemModel.Description: Introduced into Sharn by Daask, dragon’s blood is a potent and highly addictive stimulant. In addition to inducing euphoria, it can enhance spellcasting ability or even temporarily imbue a user with the ability to cast sorcerer spells. The drug’s effects are potentially dangerous and always unpredictable. This isn’t something a player character should want to use; adventurers are more likely to interfere with Daask smugglers or deal with an addict who accidentally casts a fireball in a crowded street. The specific effects of dragon’s blood are up to you, but you can take inspiration from the Wild Magic Surge table in the Player’s Handbook.

ItemModel.Name: Dreamlily
ItemModel.Description: A psychoactive liquid that smells and tastes like your favorite beverage, essence of dreamlily is a Sarlonan opiate. First imported to help manage pain during the Last War, it’s now the most commonly abused substance in Sharn. Though dreamlily isn’t illegal if used for medicinal purposes, it’s heavily taxed, and thus most dreamlily is smuggled in and sold on the black market. Dreamlily dens can be found across the lower wards. Consuming dreamlily causes disorienting euphoria and brings about remarkable resistance to pain. A creature under the effects of dreamlily is poisoned for 1 hour. While poisoned in this way, the creature is immune to fear, and the first time it drops to 0 hit points without being killed outright, it drops to 1 hit point instead. A dose of dreamlily costs around 1 gp, or up to ten times that if purchased through legal channels. There are many varieties of the drug, however, and the duration or the price might vary accordingly.

ItemModel.Name: Drow Poison
ItemModel.Description:
This poison is typically made only by the drow, and only in a place far removed from sunlight. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

ItemModel.Name: Druidic Focus
ItemModel.Description: A druid can use a Sprig of Mistletoe (or holly) as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: Dust of the Mummy
ItemModel.Description: This poison is created during a mummy’s embalming process, distilled from the dead creature’s removed organs. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed creature can’t regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the creature’s hit point maximum to 0, the creature dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

ItemModel.Name: Small Hunting Trap
ItemModel.Description: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

This paste made from the muroosa bush is known to help prevent sunburn, but it is also a fire retardant. After spending 1 minute applying a quarter pint of muroosa balm to your skin, you gain resistance against fire damage for 1 hour.
Cost: 1 gp per dose for sunburn, 100 gp for a full application against fire.

ItemModel.Name: Navigator's Tools
ItemModel.Description: This set of instruments is used for navigation at sea. Proficiency with navigator's tools lets you chart a ship's course and follow navigation charts. In addition, these tools allow you to add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to avoid getting lost at sea.

ItemModel.Name: Net
ItemModel.Description:
Proficiency with a net allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.
A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net.
When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

ItemModel.Name: Nightshade
ItemModel.Description: Swamp / Jungle ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Oil (flask)
ItemModel.Description: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

ItemModel.Name: Oil of Taggit
ItemModel.Description:
A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 24 hours. The poisoned creature is unconscious. The creature wakes up if it takes damage.
Contact. Contact poison can be smeared on an object and remains potent until it is touched or washed off. A creature that touches contact poison with exposed skin suffers its effects.

ItemModel.Name: Olisuba Leaf
ItemModel.Description: These dried leaves of the Olisuba tree, when steeped to make a tea, can help a body recover from strenuous activity. If you drink a dose of Olisuba tea during a long rest, your exhaustion level is reduced by 2 instead of 1 at the end of that long rest.

A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) poison damage and become poisoned. The poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw every 24 hours, taking 3 (1d6) poison damage on a failed save. Until this poison ends, the damage the poison deals can't be healed by any means. After seven successful saving throws, the effect ends and the creature can heal normally.
Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

ItemModel.Description: A sheet of standard paper is made from cloth fibers.

ItemModel.Name: Parchment (1 sheet)
ItemModel.Description: A sheet of parchment is a piece of goat hide or sheepskin that has been prepared for writing on.

ItemModel.Name: Pearl
ItemModel.Description: An opaque lustrous white, yellow, or pink gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Perfume (vial)
ItemModel.Description: A fragrant commodity typically used by the wealthy.

ItemModel.Name: Peridot
ItemModel.Description: A transparent rich olive green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Peyote
ItemModel.Description: Desert / Badlands ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Pike
ItemModel.Description: 1d10 piercing

ItemModel.Name: Pinkgill
ItemModel.Description: Ocean / Coast ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Pitcher
ItemModel.Description: A pitcher can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

ItemModel.Name: Piton
ItemModel.Description: When a wall doesn’t offer handholds and footholds, you can make your own. A piton is a steel spike with an eye through which you can loop a rope.

ItemModel.Name: Plate Armor
ItemModel.Description: AC 18, Stealth disadvantage. Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

ItemModel.Name: Platinum Ingot
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb. ingot of platinum.

ItemModel.Name: Playing Card Set
ItemModel.Description: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

ItemModel.Name: Poison Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Poisoner's Kit
ItemModel.Description: A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons.

ItemModel.Name: Pole (10 ft)
ItemModel.Description: When you suspect a trap, you can put the end of your 10-foot pole through that hole in the wall instead of reaching in with your hand.

ItemModel.Name: Portable Ram
ItemModel.Description: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

ItemModel.Name: Potion of Greater Healing
ItemModel.Description: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 4d4 + 4 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

ItemModel.Name: Potion of Healing
ItemModel.Description: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

ItemModel.Name: Potion of Superior Healing
ItemModel.Description: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 8d4+8 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

ItemModel.Name: Potion of Supreme Healing
ItemModel.Description: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 10d4 + 20 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

ItemModel.Name: Potion of Water Breathing
ItemModel.Description: You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion. Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

ItemModel.Name: Potter's Tools
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Pouch
ItemModel.Description: A cloth or leather pouch can hold 1/5 cubic foot/ 6 pounds of gear - or up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch.

ItemModel.Name: Pride Silk
ItemModel.Description:
The hearty silk unique to the region has long been a point of pride with the locals. When processed and woven properly, the resulting cloth is pride silk: an extremely flexible material with the durability of tanned leather. Pride silk has become a favorite cloth for use on military ship sails, war banners, and other utilitarian applications, but has also gained popularity in affluent circles. High-end clothing made from pride silk is both fashionable and protective, leading many nobles and wealthy merchants to seek full outfits and formal gowns made with it. The tailors skilled enough to create such outfits are few and far between, so while pride silk might be expensive as a raw material, outfits made of the cloth are prohibitively expensive for most common folk.
One square yard of pride silk weighs 1 pound and costs 100 gp. An outfit made of pride silk weighs 4 pounds and costs 500 gp. If you aren’t wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 11 + your Dexterity modifier while wearing it.

ItemModel.Name: Priest's Pack
ItemModel.Description: Includes a backpack, a blanket, 10 candles, a tinderbox, an alms box, 2 blocks of incense, a censer, vestments, 2 days of rations, and a waterskin.

ItemModel.Name: Psychic Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Purple Worm Poison
ItemModel.Description:
This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated purple worm. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

ItemModel.Name: Quarterstaff
ItemModel.Description: 1d6 bludgeoning, 1d8 versatile

ItemModel.Name: Quarterstaff of Vines
ItemModel.Description: During a Medium or smaller creature's movement, use your Reaction to create a vine in their path to act as a tripwire within 30 feet of you. The creature must pass a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. Able to use up to 3 times per day. Recharges at dawn.

ItemModel.Name: Quartz
ItemModel.Description: A transparent white, smoky gray, or yellow gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Quiver
ItemModel.Description: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

ItemModel.Name: Radiant Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Rain Catcher
ItemModel.Description: A rain catcher is a simple contraption consisting of a 5-foot-square leather tarp and a wooden frame with legs. When the tarp is stretched across the wooden frame, it forms a basin that can catch 2 gallons of drinking water per inch of rainfall and hold up to 8 gallons. The tarp and wooden frame fold up for easy transport. A rain catcher costs 1 gp and weighs 5 pounds.

ItemModel.Name: Rapier
ItemModel.Description: 1d8 piercing

ItemModel.Name: Rations (1 day)
ItemModel.Description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

ItemModel.Name: Reliquary
ItemModel.Description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

ItemModel.Name: Rhodochrosite
ItemModel.Description: An opaque light pink gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Ribwort
ItemModel.Description: Swamp / Jungle ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Ricoshot
ItemModel.Description: Magic +1 shortbow (1d6) When making a ranged attack with this bow, on a hit the arrow can ricochet to an additional target within 10 feet of the original target. The additional target must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the additional target takes 1d6 piercing damage, and the arrow bounces to a final target for the same saving throw and damage.

ItemModel.Name: Ring Mail
ItemModel.Description: AC 14, Stealth Disadvantage. This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

ItemModel.Name: Ring of Haste
ItemModel.Description: Wearing this ring grants +5 to the wearer's movement speed.

ItemModel.Name: Ring of Protection
ItemModel.Description: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while wearing this ring. (requires attunement)

ItemModel.Name: Ring of the Stone Sentinel
ItemModel.Description: Use an action to activate the ring. When activated, the ring turns the wearer’s body into incredibly hard stone, raising their AC to 26. While turned to stone they are unable to move or take normal actions and must use the ring again to turn back to normal. One use per long rest.
ItemModel.Lore: “So long did the guards of these halls await their king’s return that they became one with the walls themselves, a destiny befitting of blind loyalty.” - Steward Gundilyn

ItemModel.Name: Robes
ItemModel.Description: A standard set of robes.

ItemModel.Name: Rod
ItemModel.Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: Ruby
ItemModel.Description: A transparent clear red to deep crimson gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Sack
ItemModel.Description: A sack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear.

ItemModel.Name: Sardonyx
ItemModel.Description: An opaque gemstone with bands of red and white worth 50 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Scale Mail
ItemModel.Description: AC 14 + Dex (max 2). Stealth Disadvantage. This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

ItemModel.Name: Scale of the World Serpent
ItemModel.Description: Magic Shield. Grants resistance to cold damage while equipped. Requires attunement.

ItemModel.Name: Scattershot Shortbow
ItemModel.Description: When attacking you can choose to shatter the arrow in slivers that cover a 10 foot cone. Creatures in the affected area must make a Dexterity save or take 1d4 piercing damage plus modifiers. The save DC is the Dexterity score of the user.

ItemModel.Name: Scholar's Pack
ItemModel.Description: Includes a backpack, a book of lore, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, 10 sheets of parchment, a little bag of sand, and a small knife.

ItemModel.Name: Scimitar
ItemModel.Description: 1d6 slashing

ItemModel.Name: Scroll of Firebolt
ItemModel.Description: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit (+5), the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn’t being worn or carried.

ItemModel.Name: Fire Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Evocation Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Scroll of Pedigree
ItemModel.Description: A document certifying its bearer as nobility.

ItemModel.Name: Seagrass
ItemModel.Description: Ocean / Coast ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Sealing Wax
ItemModel.Description: When you press a signet ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

ItemModel.Name: Serpent Venom
ItemModel.Description:
This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated giant poisonous snake. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

ItemModel.Name: Shawm
ItemModel.Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

ItemModel.Name: Shield
ItemModel.Description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

ItemModel.Name: Shortbow
ItemModel.Description: 1d6 piercing, 80/320

ItemModel.Name: Shortsword
ItemModel.Description: 1d6 piercing

ItemModel.Name: Shovel
ItemModel.Description: A standard shovel used for digging.

ItemModel.Name: Sickle
ItemModel.Description: 1d4 slashing

ItemModel.Name: Signal Whistle
ItemModel.Description: A small whistle used for signaling.

ItemModel.Name: Signet Ring
ItemModel.Description: Each signet ring has a distinctive design carved into it. When you press this ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

ItemModel.Name: Silk Rope (50 ft)
ItemModel.Description: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

ItemModel.Name: Silver Ingot
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb. ingot of silver

ItemModel.Name: Silver Ring
ItemModel.Description: A simple silver ring to wear on one's finger.

ItemModel.Name: Skyflower
ItemModel.Description: Mountain / Cave ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Sledgehammer
ItemModel.Description: This two-handed, iron-headed hammer is good for smashing open treasure chests.

ItemModel.Name: Sling
ItemModel.Description: 1d4 bludgeoning, 30/120

ItemModel.Name: Sling Bullets
ItemModel.Description: Sling bullets are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

ItemModel.Name: Small Cut Ruby
ItemModel.Description: Small cut ruby worth 100 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Small Diamond
ItemModel.Description: A small clear diamond

ItemModel.Name: Small Knife
ItemModel.Description: A small knife, typically found in a scholar's pack.

ItemModel.Name: Small Ruby
ItemModel.Description: A small ruby worth 100 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Small Uncut Ruby
ItemModel.Description: Small uncut ruby worth 25 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Smith's Tools
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Snakeroot
ItemModel.Description: Forest / Woodland ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Snapdragon
ItemModel.Description: Desert / Badlands ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Snowdrop
ItemModel.Description: Mountain / Cave ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Soap
ItemModel.Description: A commodity used for bathing.

ItemModel.Name: Songhorn
ItemModel.Description: A recorder, a simple type of flute, usually carved from wood.

ItemModel.Name: Soothsalts
ItemModel.Description:
Soothsalts are derived from a naturally occurring crystalline substance discovered throughout the wilds of the Miskath Strand. The crimson crystals have been mined from cavernous veins like those in the mouth of the Miskath Pit and found within smaller geode formations near sites ravaged by the Calamity. Soothsalts are consumed orally in lozenge-sized doses, and frequent users can be identified by the telltale crimson stain around their mouths. A creature subjected to a dose of soothsalts gains advantage on all Intelligence checks for 1d4 hours.
For each dose of soothsalts consumed, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion—an effect which is cumulative with multiple doses.

ItemModel.Name: Spear
ItemModel.Description: 1d6 piercing, 1d8 versatile, 20/60

ItemModel.Name: Spellbook
ItemModel.Description: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

ItemModel.Name: Spiderflower
ItemModel.Description: Mountain / Cave ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Spiked Armor
ItemModel.Description: AC 14 + Dex (max 2). Stealth Disadvantage. Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.

ItemModel.Name: Spiked Shield
ItemModel.Description: A metal shield with a spike in the center used for attacking. +2 AC 1d6 piercing damage

ItemModel.Name: Steel Ingot
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb steel ingot

ItemModel.Name: Leather Roll
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb roll of leather

ItemModel.Name: Iron Ingot
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb iron ingot

ItemModel.Name: Steel Ingot
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb steel ingot

ItemModel.Name: Iron Ingot
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb iron ingot

ItemModel.Name: Spindle
ItemModel.Description: Desert / Badlands ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Spinel
ItemModel.Description: A transparent gemstone of red, red-brown, or deep green worth 100 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Splint Mail
ItemModel.Description: AC 17, Str 15, Stealth Dis. This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

ItemModel.Name: Sprig of Mistletoe
ItemModel.Description: A druid can use a Sprig of Mistletoe (or holly) as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: Spyglass
ItemModel.Description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

ItemModel.Name: Staff
ItemModel.Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: Staff of Fire
ItemModel.Description:
Requires Attunement by a Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard
You have Resistance to fire damage while you hold this staff.
The staff has 10 Charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its Charges to cast one of the following Spells from it, using your spell save DC: Burning Hands (1 charge), Fireball (3 charges), or Wall of Fire (4 charges).
The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended Charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff blackens, crumbles into cinders, and is destroyed.

ItemModel.Name: Staghorn
ItemModel.Description: Forest / Woodland ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Star Rose Quartz
ItemModel.Description: A translucent rosy Gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 50 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Star Ruby
ItemModel.Description: A translucent ruby gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Star Sapphire
ItemModel.Description: A translucent blue sapphire gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Steel Ingot
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb steel ingot

ItemModel.Name: Steel Mirror
ItemModel.Description: A steel mirror is handy when you want to look around corners, signal friends with reflected sunlight, keep an eye on a medusa, make sure that you look good enough to present yourself to the queen, or examine wounds that you’ve received on hard-to-see parts of your body.

ItemModel.Name: Stick of Incense
ItemModel.Description: A stick of incense, typically found in a priest's pack.

ItemModel.Name: Stone King's Crown
ItemModel.Description: When worn by a creature, their body turns into unbreakable stone. Time still passes for their body, however, and if the crown is not removed within a reasonable amount of time, the creature will die of natural causes once the crown is removed.
ItemModel.Lore: “Thus he sat upon his throne, content to enjoy the rest of his years surrounded by the riches he had acquired during his lifetime, until he become but another fixture of a time long forgotten.” - Steward Gundilyn

ItemModel.Name: String
ItemModel.Description: A 10-foot length of string, typically found in a burglar's pack.

ItemModel.Name: Studded Leather Armor
ItemModel.Description: AC 12 + Dex. Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

ItemModel.Name: Tabaxi Spiced Rum
ItemModel.Description: A bottle of tabaxi spiced rum

ItemModel.Name: Tankard
ItemModel.Description: A tankard can hold 1 pint of liquid.

ItemModel.Name: Tantan
ItemModel.Description: A tambourine, a popular instrument with halflings and humans south of the Dalelands.

ItemModel.Name: Tear of Denial
ItemModel.Description: A small blue tearstone shaped gemstone. Once per long rest, the attuned user can spend 10 minutes on a ritual granting a creature a buff that takes the appearance of a small flame within their heart, visible through any worn clothing. For the next 8 hours, if the target creature takes damage that would put them at or below zero, they instead stay at 1 hit point and the flame disappears.

ItemModel.Name: Terraweed
ItemModel.Description: Ocean / Coast ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Theki Root
ItemModel.Description: This thick marsh root tastes bitter but is thought to aid digestive health. When you use an action to consume a dose, you gain advantage on saving throws against the effects of poisonous or toxic substances for 8 hours.

ItemModel.Name: Thelarr
ItemModel.Description: Also known as a whistlecane, a simple and easy-to-make wind instrument cut from a reed. They are so simple, in fact, that skilled bards frequently make and give them away to children — to the parents’ delight or regret.

ItemModel.Name: Thieves' Tools
ItemModel.Description: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

ItemModel.Name: Thieving Blade
ItemModel.Description: Dagger (1d4) + 1 The unique shape of this dagger's blade allows it to be utilized as both a lockpicking tool and a weapon. While attuned to the wielder, it provides them with a +1 bonus to hit and damage as a weapon, and a +1 to a check made with thieves' tools to pick open a lock.

ItemModel.Name: Threaded Quiver
ItemModel.Description: When drawing an arrow from this quiver, you can choose to attach a magical thread up to 40 feet long to it. If an arrow with this thread hits a creature, they must make a Strength save against your strength score or become unable to willingly move away from you. They repeat this save at the beginning of their turn. The thread lasts up to 1 minute or until the user discards it as a bonus action. Only 1 thread may attach to a creature at a time.
ItemModel.Lore: Used by instructors to pin down prey and teach others to shoot.

ItemModel.Name: Three-Dragon Ante Set
ItemModel.Description: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

ItemModel.Name: Thunder Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Tiger Eye
ItemModel.Description: A translucent brown gemstone with a golden center worth 10 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Tinderbox
ItemModel.Description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch -- or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel -- takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

ItemModel.Name: Tinker's Tools
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Tiny Diamonds
ItemModel.Description: Collection of tiny diamonds

ItemModel.Name: Tiny Uncut Ruby
ItemModel.Description: Tiny uncut ruby worth 10 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Tocken
ItemModel.Description: A hanging set of carved oval bells, usually played with a pair of light wooden hammers (or open handed). They are most common in underground cultures, where the resonant tones can carry.

ItemModel.Name: Topaz
ItemModel.Description: A transparent golden yellow gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Topor
ItemModel.Description:
A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 4d6 hours. The poisoned creature is incapacitated.
Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

ItemModel.Name: Torch
ItemModel.Description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

ItemModel.Name: Totem
ItemModel.Description: A druid can use a Totem as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: Totem of Recovery
ItemModel.Description:
Requires attunement. A small stone totem depicting a fountain of life. The bearer of this totem can spend 5 minutes granting a creature a Recovery Totem, which appears as an ethereal green flask hung by a string around their neck for 1 hour. This can be cast twice per long rest.
A creature bearing this flask can utilize it as a reaction after taking damage to restore 2d6 hit points. The flask is automatically used if the damage the creature takes would drop them below zero hit points. The flask recovery amount is counted against the damage taken, and if the creatures hit points still go to zero, they fall unconscious like normal.

ItemModel.Name: Tourmaline
ItemModel.Description: A transparent pale green, blue, brown, or red gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Transmutation Rune
ItemModel.Description: Rune used for enchanting.

ItemModel.Name: Traveling Clothes
ItemModel.Description: This set of clothes could consist of boots, a wool skirt or breeches, a sturdy belt, a shirt (perhaps with a vest or jacket), and an ample cloak with a hood

ItemModel.Name: Trident
ItemModel.Description: 1d6 piercing, 1d8 versatile, 20/60

ItemModel.Name: Triton Gin
ItemModel.Description: A bottle of triton gin

ItemModel.Name: Truffle
ItemModel.Description: Swamp / Jungle ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Truth Serum
ItemModel.Description:
A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. The poisoned creature can't knowingly speak a lie, as if under the effect of a zone of truth spell.
Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

ItemModel.Name: Turquoise
ItemModel.Description: An opaque light blue-green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Two-Person Tent
ItemModel.Description: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

ItemModel.Name: Ursavil
ItemModel.Description: Ocean / Coast ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Vestments
ItemModel.Description: Religious clothing, typically found in a priest's pack.

ItemModel.Name: Vial
ItemModel.Description: A vial can hold 4 ounces of liquid.

ItemModel.Name: Viol
ItemModel.Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

ItemModel.Name: Vipergrass
ItemModel.Description: Grassland / Hillside ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Wand
ItemModel.Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: War Pick
ItemModel.Description: 1d8 piercing

ItemModel.Name: Wargong
ItemModel.Description: A metal gong, traditionally made from a shield, particularly the shield of an enemy. Both goblins and dwarves make and play wargongs, their sound echoing through tunnels in the Underdark.

ItemModel.Name: Warhammer
ItemModel.Description: 1d8 bludgeoning, 1d10 versatile

ItemModel.Name: Waterskin
ItemModel.Description: A waterskin can hold 4 pints of liquid.

ItemModel.Name: Weak Acid
ItemModel.Description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 acid damage.

ItemModel.Name: Weaver's Tools
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Weighted Dice
ItemModel.Description: Dice that have been weighted to land more frequently upon a favored outcome.

ItemModel.Name: Whetstone
ItemModel.Description: A standard whetstone used to sharpen blades.

ItemModel.Name: Whip
ItemModel.Description: 1d4 slashing

ItemModel.Name: Willowshade Oil
ItemModel.Description: A dark blue oil can be extracted from the rare fruit of the willowshade plant. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been petrified for less than 1 minute, causing the petrified condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature’s next turn.

ItemModel.Name: Windflower
ItemModel.Description: Desert / Badlands ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Wisteria
ItemModel.Description: Mountain / Cave ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Wklwa
ItemModel.Description: 1d8 piercing, 10/30. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long.

ItemModel.Name: Wolfsbane
ItemModel.Description: Forest / Woodland ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Wood Plank
ItemModel.Description: 1 lb wood plank

ItemModel.Name: Woodcarver's Tools
ItemModel.Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

ItemModel.Name: Wooden Staff
ItemModel.Description: A druid can use a Wooden Staff as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: Wooden Stake
ItemModel.Description: Stakes made out of wood, typically found in a monster hunter's pack.

ItemModel.Name: Wormwood
ItemModel.Description: Swamp / Jungle ingredient.

ItemModel.Name: Wyvern Poison
ItemModel.Description:
This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated wyvern. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

ItemModel.Name: Yarting
ItemModel.Description: A southern instrument from Amn and Calimshan that is a Faerûnian analog to the guitar. Numerous variations have spread across the continent.

ItemModel.Name: Yellow Sapphire
ItemModel.Description: A transparent fiery yellow or yellow-green gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

ItemModel.Name: Yew Wand
ItemModel.Description: A druid can use a Yew Wand as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

ItemModel.Name: Yuan-Ti Tequila
ItemModel.Description: A bottle of yuan-ti tequila

ItemModel.Name: Zircon
ItemModel.Description: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

ItemModel.Name: Zulkoon
ItemModel.Description: A complex pump organ that originated with the zulkirs of Thay, who use it in the casting of their spells. It is considered to have a dramatic, but sinister, sound
